intro: Ziziphus cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian date tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are typically consumed fresh or used in traditional remedies. Ziziphus cambodiana is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
